Best puzzle game I have ever played. 9/10

This certainly does not contain the heart-pounding action of Valve's other titles, yet it is quite the intellectually challenging experience in that it requires a lot of thinking. The humor is good and the puzzles unique and interesting, changing up locations so that it does no get too stale. However, sometimes the loactions and music overstay their welcome a bit. In any case, this is overall a good game that'd make a great addition to your library.

I've played through this game a total of three times, and each time I find it fun to search for achievements and easter eggs. Definelty worth your time, 40 hours can easily be put into it. Great story, great gameplay, interesting puzzles.

very positive

Portal 2's a great example of a sequel done really well. It takes the basic concept of the first game and totally revamps it with new puzzles, areas, lore and characters. The humor is also super well done, from Glados and Wheatleys banter to even the few lines muttered by the turrets. Theres a lot of love and care put into this game and its plain to see. Not only that its got both a single player and co-op campaign. Definitely get this if youre even slightly interested, its a classic.

Just as amazing as it was back in 2011. A fantastic story with a fun co op mode and not to mention the thousands of tests (puzzles) players have made not to mention you can create your own tests, making replay value almost infinite.

A Fantastic game that i can safely say will age very well with time
Love Portal 2, great game! The RP is hilarious and the puzzle get kinda hard, gonna sad when it's completed :(

One of Valve's finest, if not the finest. Portal 2 did everything its predecessor did but better. Valve is known for its incredible and engaging story-telling in their games and this is a perfect example of it. If you never have gotten into this series, you are seriously missing out. If you are a lover of puzzles and invigorating narrative, this is a must have. This game is one of my favorites of all time and i hope Valve can somehow through together a third installment in this series.

wish i had a portal gun :(

Reviewing Portal 2 in 2018 is a wonderfully astounding thing to do, would recommend to play again.  I feel as if there should be a update such as the Half-Life update.
Lets go over stats of Portal 2 in 2018
Pros
1. The graphics hold up and it is very easy to run with great optimization.
2. Story line matches up woth newer games.
3. MUSIC IS STILL AMAZING

Cons
1. While the fanbase may not be dying it seems as if community maps are either going down in quality or are less fun to make.
Game has a very weird bug. Have no audio and whenever i wish to change audio settings, the game freezes. Preventing me from even trying to end the process in the task manager as the overlay is buggy.

Divertido, porÃ©m se torna sem graÃ§a de vc for procurar a historia do jogo. 
Mas pela mecÃ¢nica , preÃ§o, qualidade geral do jogo, acho q vale a pena.
This is genuinely my favourite game ever. None will ever top it. If you haven't already bought it, do it NOW. It is a bargain at ANY (and I mean any) price.

After your previous adventure looking for cake, you now want to escape the cake factory place! Using the same gun that spawns portals to hell and back, you adventure through the same cake factory, with a little ball that f***s it all up, turning the caretaker into a potato. You fall into a ditch where you gotta go back to the cake factory and kill the spastic little f*** who ruined it all and send him to space. Once you beat the campaign, you can play multiplayer! Grab Fat B**tard the robot or his brother Hungry Child and use the portals through hell to beat YET ANOTHER CAMPAIGN (or just download some workshop maps)! If this game isn't fun, then nothing is!
Made me think super 8 was going to be a cool game not some crappy movie.

Story. Absolutely delightful humor and background. Characters, though few, are charming. The style of story-telling is iconic.
Gameplay. Simple mechanics that interplay perfectly to add a lot of depth that remains uncomplicated. The puzzles are intuitive but this is definitely not a walking simulator. 
Presentation. This game looks and sounds fantastic. The setting is fun and the game has moments that are breathtaking.

I played through the game in about 6 hours but there is a LOT more content available through community made mods and co-op modes.
